summary: This is an email chain from September 2021 between a federal prosecutor and an FAA Special Agent, detailing the complex ownership history of multiple aircraft and shell companies linked to Jeffrey Epstein and his associates. The document traces aircraft registrations, tail number changes, and corporate transfers, revealing the network used to control Epstein's aviation assets.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.role: Pilot / Director of Aviation / Manager of LLCs
persons.context: Appears repeatedly as the registrant, manager, or director for various Epstein-linked aircraft companies (Air Ghislaine Inc., Shmitka Air Inc., Hyperion Air LLC, Plan D LLC, JEGE LLC). Signed numerous FAA documents.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Signed aircraft registration documents as Vice President for Freedom Air International Inc. and JEGE Inc., and as Corporate Secretary for Hyperion Air Inc. Handled sales of aircraft.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Identified as a member of Plan D LLC and JEGE LLC, and as CEO of JEGE Inc. His signature appears on older aircraft documents. The investigation is focused on aircraft linked to him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a search term for the FAA investigation, indicating her connection to the entities and aircraft being traced.

persons.name: Melinda Westbrook
persons.context: Listed as the contact for ASI Wings LLC in Hartford, CT, which bought and sold aircraft (N722JE, N162AE) connected to the Epstein network.

persons.name: Richard Munkvold
persons.role: CFO of Industrial Integrity Solutions Inc.
persons.context: Signed as CFO for Industrial Integrity Solutions Inc. when it purchased helicopter N722JE from Hyperion Air LLC in May 2021.

persons.name: Thomas H. Huff
persons.context: Identified as the manager of JEGE LLC in 2019 and a pilot of interest to the DEA. He is suspected of having bought JEGE LLC, which included an aircraft.

persons.name: James Previti
persons.context: Signed as manager of Frontier JV LLC, the member of N550GP LLC, which acquired aircraft N212JE in December 2020.

persons.name: Robert L. Stallings III
persons.context: Listed as the secured party for a $2.8 million aircraft security agreement filed against aircraft N120JE (owned by JEGE Inc.) in June 2019.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Signed as Chief Pilot for Hyperion Air Inc. on a 1994 aircraft purchase document where Jeffrey Epstein signed as President.

persons.name: Oscar Faria
persons.context: Listed as the contact for Starbridge Landing Inc., Dover, Delaware, which purchased aircraft N9091E from Hyperion Air Inc. in November 2013.

persons.name: James P. Miller
persons.role: Executive Vice President of Flight Options LLC
persons.context: Signed a bill of sale as Executive Vice President of Flight Options LLC, acting as attorney-in-fact for Air Ghislaine Inc. in 2009.

persons.name: Michael Metera
persons.role: Director of Sales Administration of Flight Options LLC
persons.context: Signed a bill of sale as Director of Sales Administration of Flight Options LLC, acting as attorney-in-fact for Freedom Air International Inc. in 2011.

persons.name: John F. Kohler
persons.context: Listed as the contact for Greenwich Aerogroup Inc. Brazil Leasing Inc. when it purchased aircraft N162AD from Freedom Air International Inc. in 2012.

connections.description: Visoski served as pilot and manager for multiple Epstein-linked aircraft companies (Plan D LLC, JEGE LLC). Documents state he was a pilot for Epstein.
Indyke served as Vice President or Corporate Secretary for multiple Epstein-linked companies (JEGE Inc., Hyperion Air Inc., Freedom Air International Inc.), handling aircraft registrations and sales.
Both repeatedly signed FAA registration documents for the same network of aircraft companies (Air Ghislaine, Shmitka Air, Freedom Air International, Hyperion Air).
Maxwell is listed as a search term alongside Epstein in the FAA investigation, and a company was named 'Air Ghislaine Inc.'
Both served as managers for JEGE LLC at different times. Huff is suspected of buying JEGE LLC, which included an aircraft previously managed by Visoski.

events.title: Sikorsky Helicopter Purchase by Air Ghislaine
events.description: Sikorsky S-76C-2 helicopter (tail N750A) sold to Air Ghislaine Inc. Larry Visoski signed as Director of Aviation.

events.title: Gulfstream Purchase by Plan D LLC
events.description: Gulfstream G550 (tail N415LM) sold by Chevron USA Inc. to Plan D LLC. Lawrence Visoski signed as Manager. Documents state Jeffrey Epstein was a member of Plan D LLC.

events.title: Final Flights of Epstein's Gulfstream
events.description: Aircraft N212JE (owned by Jeffrey Epstein) operated from Paris, France to Teterboro, NJ, then to Brunswick, GA (KBQK) days before Epstein's arrest.

events.title: Aircraft Location Report
events.description: An informant reported that aircraft N212JE, owned by Jeffrey Epstein, was in a hangar at Cobb County airport in Georgia.

events.title: Sale of Epstein's Gulfstream
events.description: Lawrence Visoski, on behalf of Plan D LLC, 'sold' aircraft N212JE to Six G Aviation LLC, which immediately sold it to N550GP LLC, effectively transferring the asset.

events.title: Sale of Sikorsky Helicopter
events.description: Hyperion Air LLC (Larry Visoski) sold helicopter N722JE to Industrial Integrity Solutions Inc. Richard Munkvold signed as CFO.

locations: 6100 Red Hook Quarter, B3, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands 00802
457 Madison Avenue, 4th floor, New York, NY 10022
3800 Southern Blvd., Suite 204, West Palm Beach, FL 33406
keyFacts: The document reveals a complex web of shell companies (Air Ghislaine, Shmitka Air, Freedom Air International, Hyperion Air, Plan D LLC, JEGE LLC) used to own and manage at least 10 aircraft linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
Key associates Lawrence Visoski (pilot/manager) and Darren Indyke (attorney/Vice President) repeatedly signed FAA registration documents for these aircraft, facilitating their ownership and transfer.

Epstein's Gulfstream N212JE made flights from Paris to Teterboro, NJ, and then to Brunswick, GA in July 2019, just before his arrest, and was later sold through a rapid series of transactions in December 2020.
The FAA investigation was coordinated with the FBI in Atlanta and the DEA, indicating multi-agency interest in Epstein's aviation assets as part of a broader financial investigation.
Corporate documents filed with the FAA explicitly listed Jeffrey Epstein as a member of Plan D LLC and JEGE LLC, directly linking him to the ownership of specific aircraft.
